alert.note: Alert for Norman (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 21 at 11:40AM CST until February 22 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...In Minnesota, Norman County. In North Dakota, Traill, Griggs and Steele Counties. * WHEN...Until noon CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult to impossible. Near blizzard conditions at times, and significant drifting snow could lead to impassable roads. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 40 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for North Dakota can be found at dot.nd.gov/travel and for Minnesota at 511mn.org, or by calling 5 1 1 in either state.
